required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Intermittent Fasting Following Acute Ischemic Stroke
clinical_study.official_title: Intermittent Fasting Following Acute Ischemic Stroke: Prospective, Randomized, Parallel Group, Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Despite numerous kinds of evidence on functional health and CNS protection of intermittent fasting after injuries were found in many brain-, and spinal cord-damaged animal models, there has yet to be any clinical study of intermittent fasting after acute ischemic cerebral infarction. The aim of this study is to evaluate the neurological, functional and clinical efficacy of intermittent fasting in patients after acute ischemic stroke.

detailed_description.textblock: In order to verify the validity and clinical efficacy of intermittent fasting for neurological and functional effects of ischemic cerebral infarction, the first ischemic stroke (diagnosed within 1 year through brain MRI / CT) patients will be randomly assigned to intermittent fasting group or control group. In both groups, physical therapy, occupational therapy and speech therapy will be provided during 3 hours in total a day. The intermittent fasting group should maintain intermittent fasting for no less than 12 hours or more every day during the rehabilitation period (at least 1 week), and the control group is able to eat all of the hospital meals and all the participants want without any time limit. The efficacy of intermittent fasting is to be verified by performing the electro-physiological tests and functional evaluations before participation, 1st week, 2nd weeks after participation, before discharge, 3 months, and 6 months after the stroke onset.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 day before the initiation of intervention, and 6 months after the stroke onset
primary_outcome.description: root mean square and root peak square of compound motor action potential

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 day before the initiation of intervention and 3rd week after start of intervention, 3 months and 6 months after the stroke onset
secondary_outcome.description: Korean version-Modified Barthel Index (minimum of 0 and maximum scores of 100); higher values and a better outcome.

other_outcome.measure: Change of Mini mental status exam
other_outcome.time_frame: 1 day before the initiation of intervention and 3rd week after start of intervention, 3 months and 6 months after the stroke onset
other_outcome.description: Mini mental status exam(minimum of 0 and maximum scores of 30); higher values and a better outcome.

other_outcome.time_frame: 1 day before the initiation of intervention and 3rd week after start of intervention, 3 months and 6 months after the stroke onset
other_outcome.description: Beck depression inventory(minimum of 0 and maximum scores of 63); higher values and a worse outcome.

other_outcome.time_frame: 1 day before the initiation of intervention and 3rd week after start of intervention, 3 months and 6 months after the stroke onset
other_outcome.description: Wecsler aphasia battery(minimum of 0 and maximum scores of 100); higher values and a better outcome.

other_outcome.time_frame: 1 day before the initiation of intervention and 3rd week after start of intervention, 3 months and 6 months after the stroke onset
other_outcome.description: Berg balance scale(minimum of 0 and maximum scores of 56); higher values and a better outcome.

other_outcome.time_frame: 1 day before the initiation of intervention and 3rd week after start of intervention, 3 months and 6 months after the stroke onset
other_outcome.description: Functional Ambulation Category(minimum of 0 and maximum scores of 5); higher values and a better outcome.

other_outcome.time_frame: 1 day before the initiation of intervention and 3rd week after start of intervention, 3 months and 6 months after the stroke onset
other_outcome.description: Motricity Index(minimum of 0 and maximum scores of 99); higher values and a better outcome.

other_outcome.time_frame: 1 day before the initiation of intervention and 3rd week after start of intervention, 3 months and 6 months after the stroke onset
other_outcome.description: 10m walking test

other_outcome.time_frame: 1 day before the initiation of intervention and 3rd week after start of intervention, 3 months and 6 months after the stroke onset
other_outcome.description: Grasping force (kg)

other_outcome.time_frame: 1 day before the initiation of intervention and 3rd week after start of intervention, 3 months and 6 months after the stroke onset
other_outcome.description: 9-hole pegboard

other_outcome.time_frame: 1 day before the initiation of intervention and 3rd week after start of intervention, 3 months and 6 months after the stroke onset
other_outcome.description: Jebsen-Taylor Hand Function Test

other_outcome.time_frame: 1 day before the initiation of intervention and 3rd week after start of intervention, 3 months and 6 months after the stroke onset
other_outcome.description: Nottingham sensory scale(minimum of 0 and maximum scores of 20); higher values and a better outcome.

other_outcome.measure: Change of Arm motor Fugl-Mayer scale
other_outcome.time_frame: 1 day before the initiation of intervention and 3rd week after start of intervention, 3 months and 6 months after the stroke onset
other_outcome.description: Arm motor Fugl-Mayer scale; wrist & hand/proximal arm(minimum of 0 and maximum scores of 24 and of 34, respectively ); higher values and a better outcome.

other_outcome.time_frame: 1 day before the initiation of intervention and 3rd week after start of intervention, 3 months and 6 months after the stroke onset
other_outcome.description: Hand motor, Stroke Impact Scale (minimum of 12 and maximum scores of 60); higher values and a better outcome.

other_outcome.time_frame: 1 day before the initiation of intervention and 3rd week after start of intervention, 3 months and 6 months after the stroke onset
other_outcome.description: Ashworth scale; elbow, wrist, knee & ankle(minimum of 0 and maximum scores of 4); higher values and a worse outcome.

other_outcome.time_frame: 1 day before the initiation of intervention and 3rd week after start of intervention, 3 months and 6 months after the stroke onset
other_outcome.description: The smallest iso-kinetic angle from which the participants could detect any passive flexion or extension movement of their own knee, using Biodex; (minimum of 0 and maximum scores of 360 degree); higher values and a worse outcome.

other_outcome.time_frame: 1 day before the initiation of intervention and 3rd week after start of intervention, 3 months and 6 months after the stroke onset
other_outcome.description: Behavioral inatention test(minimum of 0 and maximum scores of 146); higher values and a better outcome.

other_outcome.measure: Change of Apraxia screen of Tulia
other_outcome.time_frame: 1 day before the initiation of intervention and 3rd week after start of intervention, 3 months and 6 months after the stroke onset
other_outcome.description: Apraxia screen of (minimum of 0 and maximum scores of 12); higher values and a better outcome.

other_outcome.time_frame: 1 day before the initiation of intervention, and 6 months after the stroke onset
other_outcome.description: Amplitude (uV) of motor evoked potential was recorded on abductor pollicis brevis and extentor digitorum brevis following trans-cranial magnetic stimulation for cortico-spinal excitability.

other_outcome.time_frame: 1 day before the start of intervention and 1 weeks and 2 weeks after the start of intervention
other_outcome.description: Weight (Kg)

other_outcome.time_frame: 1 day before the start of intervention and 1 weeks and 2 weeks after the start of intervention
other_outcome.description: temperature (Celsius)

other_outcome.time_frame: 1 day before the start of intervention and 1 weeks and 2 weeks after the start of intervention
other_outcome.description: Serum glucose level (mg/ml)

other_outcome.time_frame: every day following the start of intervention until 2 weeks of intervention
other_outcome.description: Assessment of hypoglycemic symptoms using Likert scale (minimum of 0 and maximum scores of 10); higher values and a worse outcome.

arm_group.description: Over rehabilitation treatment during and admission (at least 1 week), intermittent fasting (IF) for more than 12 hours (water can be allowed). For subgroup assignment, participants can choose IF1 (eat early in the evening and late in the morning) or Post-IF2 (eat the remaining two meals without breakfast), depending on own their faver.
Participants will be allowed to have hospital meals and all the desired intake without time limit.

intervention.description: The aforementioned intermittent fasting in arm/group descriptions.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who was diagnosed first ischemic stroke within preceeding 1 year through brain MRI/CT
Exclusion Criteria:
- Musculo-skeletal disease with limbs malformation or joint contracture
- Weigh more than 135 kg or taller than 195 cm
- Diabetes mellitus
- unstable patient in neurology
- Refusal of participation
